meanings.definition: Something that is extremely impressive or surprising.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks display was a real mindblowers.
meanings.sent2: The magician's tricks were true mindblowers.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist in the movie was a mindblowers for the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for painting was a mindblowers that left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent5: The grand finale of the concert was a mindblowers that no one could forget.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that astounds or amazes.
meanings.sent1: The young prodigy was a true mindblowers in the music industry.
meanings.sent2: The natural wonders of the world are real mindblowers.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot was a mindblowers at the pet show.
meanings.sent4: His invention was a mindblowers that changed the way we live.
meanings.sent5: The acrobat's performance was a mindblowers that left the audience speechless.
